Bag O' Links - 30/8/2009

Since Snow Leopard is out and dancing, i thought it would be nice to collect a bunch of links that might scare off the upgrading pains i heard about to the Rails environment.

  • Fixing RubyGems, MySQL and Passenger on Snow Leopard
  • Epic Snow Leopard Upgrade
  • Snow Leopard Ruby/Rails Developer Setup
  • Snow Leopard Tweaks you didn’t know
  • Snow Leopard: Upgrading for Rails developers

Hopefully this will cover most of the issues i’ll run into tomorrow :)

now, for the serious part of this evening:

  • on Rake – Rake, RakeFile and fun overview.
  • Best jQuery charting plugins – Yai.
  • Baseline – another CSS framework.
  • SearchLogic OR searches – Yai, finally.
  • Rails invoicing framework – a framework created to simplify the need of invoicing on Rails applications, didn’t take a look at the documentation, hopefully it’s awesome.
  • iPhone, JSON, flickr tutorial – my love/hate relationship with Objective-c continues.
  • Git workflow for Developers – @kensodev, read it.
  • Rewriting the Rails ‘Returning’ method – fun.

GitHub Treasures

  • acts_as_eventable – README sucks, but i am on a quest to find a good activity stream plugin/implementation idea.
  • awesome_email – simplify HTML emails on Rails.
  • app_lego – a collection of Rails templates.
  • Scanty – blog platform in rails.
  • cmd_tweet – tweet from your comman line with this Gem.
  • Generic Generator – Generate loads of test data.
